bibl.title: George Alexander Mirianon vs. John Boyle and R. Label-Mahy. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: January 24, 1914 No. 2663 HEARING
In the matter of application of George Alexander Mirianon for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now on this day this cause comes on for hearing. John J. Sullican, appearing for Petitioner, and Winter S. Martin, Assistant U. S. Attorney, appearing for United States, and Jack Sommers appearing for French Counsul, whereupon the Court, after hearing arguments of respective counsel, grants petition but stays same until January 29, 1914, to begin new proceedings and in any event Defendant is not to be discharged but to be turned over to the Immigration authorities.
January 20, 1914. No. 2663
In the matter of the application for Writ of Habeas Corpus of George Alexander Mirianon.

Now on this day this cause comes on for hearing, the Government represented by W. S. Martin and John J. Sullivan for the Petitioner, whereupon writ is granted and show cause order signed in open Court. Order in forma pauperis is granted and signed in open Court, writ returnable January 23, 1914.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN the Matter of the Application of GEORGE ALEXANDER MARIANIN for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE.

The above named petitioner, having made application to this Court for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, addressed to John Boyle, United Stated Marshal, Western division, Washington, and to R. de Label-Mahy, Vice Counsul of France and to such persons or agents acting by or through or under them, in whose custody the petitioner is shown by his petition to be confined and restrained from his liberty, pursuant to certain proceedings looking to his deportation and return to the Republic of France on board the French Bark, Anne de Bretagne.
And the Court being fully advised by John J. Sullivan, counsel for the petitioner,

IT IS ORDERED that the Hon. John Boyle, Marshal of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, or such persons acting under or through said party show cause before this Court at the Court room in the Federal Building in the City of Seattle on the 23rd day of January, 1914, at 2 o'clock in the after noon, why said application should not be granted, and in the meantime, you, the Marshal of the Western District ofWashington, and you the Vice Counsul of France, R. de Label-Mahy, as well as such persons who are acting under or through you, as wel as the inspectors in charge of the person of Petitioner, refrain and desist from deporting or placing or removing said Petitioner from said District or carrying into effect any warrant or order for his deportation which may be held by you or either of you.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a certified copy of this Order shall be served upon John Boyle, Marshal for the Western District
of Washington and a copy of the same shall also be served upon R. de Label-Mahy, Vice Counsul of France, or any such person in charge of the said George Alexander Marianin, petitioner, on or before the 20 day of January, 1914.
Done this 20 day of January, 1914.
FORM NO. 282.
RETURN ON SERVICE OF WRIT.
United States of America Western DISTRICT OF Washington } ss:

I hereby certify and return that I served and annexed Order to Show Cause on the therein-named John M. Boyle, United States Marshal, and R. de Label-Mahy, Vice-Consul of France by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with John M. Boyle, United States Marshal, and R. de Label Mahy, Vice-Consul of France personally at Seattle in said District on the 20th day of January A. D. 1914
Marshal's fees $4.13
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JAN 22 1914 FRANK L. CROSBY, By Deputy
IN THE SUPERIOR DISTRICT COURT STATE OF WASHINGTON KING COUNTY
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF GEORGE ALEXANDER MARIANON FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. Plaintiff vs. Defendant
ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JAN 19 1914
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk By EML Deputy
div1.p: BEELER AND SULLIVAN Attorneys for Petitioner. 412-416 Arcade Annex SEATTLE, WASHINGTON PHONE: MAIN 907
